intro: Werneria dactylophylla f. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-leaved werneria, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its glabrous, or hairless, foliage and slender, upright stems. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. This plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny conditions. Due to its limited distribution and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
